citeinfo.origin: Ecotrust, Pacific GIS, and Conservation International
citeinfo.title: Vegetation (Interim Land Cover)

descript.abstract: Data Type: Vegetation/Land Cover/Soils; Pacific GIS used several different full resolution vegetation datasets organized by 1:250,000 scale USGS quadrangles to cover the Prince William Sound - Copper River ecosystem. The USGS EROS Alaska Field Office developed the Interim Land Cover dataset which is based on Landsat Multispectral Sensor (MSS) satellite imagery with an original resolution of 80 meters. Pacific GIS developed a cross-walk from the interim land cover vegetation types to the closest equivalent vegetation type in the Alaska Vegetation Classification scheme to provide a common classification that can be used across the ecosystem for various sources of vegetation data. This common classification has been added to the original classification information.

idinfo.accconst: Data transfer costs will be based on staff time and media costs.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
